executive_summary: The petting zoo industry mainly provides public and private petting zoo experiences to people of all ages. Over the years to 2024, industry performance was impacted by macroeconomic conditions like declining unemployment and increasing disposable income. The industry experienced volatility due to COVID-19, causing temporary closures and visitor limits. Revenue grew at a CAGR of 3.8% to $107.2 million over the last few years, with an estimated 0.8% increase in 2024. Though private funding increased, government funding remains minimal, requiring operators to sell high-profit products. Profit has been volatile in 2024 but is not expected to fully recover to pre-pandemic levels.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Disrupted Activity in the Entertainment Sector
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic required petting zoos in certain states to be closed for a period as social distancing protocols were enforced. When travel resumed in 2021 and 2022, increased tourism boosted revenue significantly before stabilizing in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Attendance and Donations Have Increased Alongside Disposable Income
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising disposable income contributed to increased tourism activity, significantly boosting revenue for operators near tourist destinations. Since easing COVID-19 restrictions, domestic and inbound trips increased exponentially.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Positive Economic Conditions Encourage New Entrants
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising income and discretionary spending is expected to drive spending on ancillary products and services. Operators will likely raise admission prices over the next five years in line with inflation. As incomes grow, higher prices are not expected to deter consumers, benefiting the industry and attracting new entrants.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Operators Will Continue to Rethink Animal Presentation
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: For decades, petting zoos have faced public scrutiny due to reported poor living conditions and animal abuse. With the rise of animal-rights organizations and social media, the public has made its voice clear: adjust these structures or risk losing patrons.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry run zoos where individuals can approach and pet small animals.
key_trends: The price of petting zoos is a major form of competition. Petting zoo providers must ensure that prices are competitive so that customers remain loyal.
Petting zoo facilities benefit from being located near schools and other public facilities. By operating near these facilities, operators can minimize costs spent on acquiring key customers.

The petting zoo industry includes operators primarily providing petting zoo experiences in public or private locations. Over the five years to 2024, the industry grew despite taking a major hit in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Growth will slow over the next five years. While demand will continue to expand, since many people still love petting zoos, the rate of revenue increases will subside throughout 2029.
Petting zoo operators don't benefit from any specific government assistance. The industry does receive some indirect assistance from various related industry associations.

The increasing diversity of the population has improved demand for the industry's services. Older demographics tend to utilize petting zoos more frequently as they are good places to get more information about particular animals and learn.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Children aged 11 and younger are the largest market segment for petting zoos. Children in this age range frequently request to go to petting zoos. As a result of this age range, many petting zoos will offer the little children pony rides and other activities to keep the kids entertained.

People aged 12 to 20 represent the smallest market segment for petting zoos. People in this age range typically feel "too old" to go to a petting zoo. As a result, most teens do not request to go, keeping this market the smallest share of revenue.

Adults aged 21 and older represent the second largest market for the petting zoo industry. Most adults typically go to petting zoos with their kids as a way to spend quality family time. In addition, some adults may also request to go to a petting zoo to learn more about the animals.

products_and_services.product_description: Petting zoo admissions refer to the price of admission tickets. Admission tickets are the largest product segment for petting zoo operators, as every person is required to have a ticket before they can enter a petting zoo.

Traveling petting zoos refer to a mobile or portable zoo that brings a variety of animals to different locations. These petting zoos enable people, especially children, to interact and learn about the animals up close. This type of petting zoo enables all different types of people to experience a petting zoo, where they typically do not have one.

Private party services are when a petting zoo operator brings various animals to a person's private home. These types of petting zoos are typically done for a birthday party, where all the animals and staff will come to the consumer's house and set up the petting zoo near their home.

Animal feed and merchandise refers to the products consumers can buy while inside the petting zoo. Most petting zoos will offer consumers to buy food for the animals in the petting zoo. This enables the consumers to feed the animals directly from their hands. Other merchandise may include memorabilia for consumers to remember their experience.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Domestic trips by US residents represents overall demand for travel within the United States. As people are more willing to travel, demand for day trips and outdoor activities grows. This benefits the Petting Zoos industry because industry establishments are often based in rural areas that customers need to travel to. A rise in the number of domestic trips by US residents would represent a potential opportunity for the industry.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Number of Children Aged Nine and Younger
demand_determinants.determinant_description: While petting zoos have customers from all age groups, young children represent most petting zoo visitors. Petting zoos are typically designed for young children and cater to this demographic. As the number of young children rises, so does demand for petting zoos.

Per capita disposable income measures the dollar amount the average person has after paying for necessities. When disposable income levels rise, people are more likely to spend money on family outings such as visiting petting zoos. A decline in per capita disposable income would pose a potential threat to the industry.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand From Museums, Historical Sites and Similar Institutions
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Museums, historical sites and other institutions serve as both compliments and competitors for the Petting Zoos industry. While all of these establishments compete for demand from families, they often complement each other, with farm museums, zoos and historical sites sometimes operating their own petting zoos. As demand for these establishments grows, so does demand for petting zoos.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of both establishments (around 30%) and population (around 25%).
The Mid-Atlantic region also has a relatively higher percentage of establishments and population compared to other regions.
The Great Lakes region also has a relatively higher percentage of establishments and population compared to other regions.
The New England region also has a lower percentage of establishments and population compared to other regions.
The Plains region also has a lower percentage of establishments and population compared to other regions.
The Rocky Mountains region has the lowest percentage of both establishments (around 5%) and population (around 5%).

barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance is low and steady.

basis_points.basis_description: The price of petting zoos is a major form of competition.
Petting zoo facilities benefit from being located near schools and other public facilities.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Industry globalization is low and steady.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages represent the largest expense incurred by industry operators
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Petting zoos require a variety of highly skilled and trained personnel, like veterinarians, zoologists, and aquarists.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Profit typically volatile for petting zoos
volatility_points.volatility_description: Profit is mainly dependent on disposable income levels and consumers' ability to visit a petting zoo.

FAQs.question: What is the regulation level?
FAQs.answer: The regulation level is described as LOW and STEADY.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The level of industry assistance is described as LOW and STEADY.
